title: Remaining Gaps in Beads-Native Skill Set
Phase 1: Debug Workflow
description:
1. Create /debug skill for CI failures, failing tests, bugs
2. Integrates with beads (creates/closes bug issues)
3. Works on current branch or specific beads issue

title: Phase 2: Graphite Wrapper
description:
4. Create /gt skill for common Graphite operations
5. Supports: log, restack, sync, info, amend
6. Maintains beads sync on state-changing operations

title: Phase 3: Resume PR Work
description:
7. Create /resume-work skill (avoids collision with built-in /resume)
8. Primary use case: returning to a PR after a break
9. Shows: PR status, CI check results, unresolved review comments, in_progress beads for current branch
10. Suggests next action: fix CI, address comments, continue implementation

title: Phase 4: Fix Workflow
description:
11. Create /fix skill for post-implementation feedback
12. User provides feedback on recent implementation
13. Skill creates beads issues from the feedback (one per finding)
14. Output: list of new beads ready for /prepare → /implement
15. Does NOT implement fixes itself — just structures feedback into actionable beads

title: Build /commit skill: conventional commit + bd sync
Swarm: Teams-First Workflow & Beads Patterns

Swarm molecule orchestrating epic claude-gsv.

title: I want to delete all of my existing Skills so that I can start fresh on redesigning new skills
Explore: team-centric explore skill with swarm planning
design:
Extend explore with --swarm flag to auto-create beads epic + children
from plan phases. Implement skill detects epic vs task and spawns
team with pull-loop workers using bd ready/bd update --claim.
Dependencies parsed from prose markers or default sequential.
Plan doc stays markdown-first in .jim/plans/ as canonical source.
5 phases: parse → beads integration → swarm mode → polish → advanced.

title: Build /start skill: create Graphite branch + create/claim beads issue
Rebuild skills as beads-native workflow
Teams-First Workflow & Beads Patterns
Phase 1: Default-Team Wiring
description:
1. Update /explore to alias /team-explore
2. Update /implement to spawn team-build by default, add --solo flag
3. Update /next-phase to spawn team for phase execution

title: Phase 2: Swarm Pattern
description:
4. Create /team-swarm skill with pull-loop worker prompt
5. Add task decomposition logic: parse Next Steps into dependency graph
6. Add worker monitoring: lead tracks progress, handles stuck agents
7. Integrate with /implement: when plan has 3+ independent tasks, use swarm

title: Phase 3: Polish
description:
8. Add --solo flag to all team-default skills
9. Add /ready skill: show unblocked work across all active implementations
10. Tune worker count defaults based on task complexity
11. Add conflict detection for overlapping file targets

title: Swarm: Remaining Gaps in Beads-Native Skill Set
description:
Swarm molecule orchestrating epic claude-5jp.

Epic: claude-5jp
Coordinator:

title: Explore: eliminate .jim/ in favor of beads-native workflow
design:
# Eliminate .jim/ in Favor of Beads-Native Workflow

## Core Idea
Store all exploration plans, review notes, and state in beads
fields (design, notes, acceptance_criteria) instead of .jim/ files.

## Current .jim/ Usage (4 skills affected)
- **explore**: writes to .jim/plans/<topic>.md
- **prepare**: reads from .jim/plans/*.md
- **review**: writes to .jim/notes/review-*.md
- **implement**: references .jim/plans/ for context

7 skills have zero .jim/ dependency already.

## Beads Field Mapping
| Current | Beads Field |
|---------|-------------|
| .jim/plans/<topic>.md | design field |
| .jim/notes/review-*.md | notes field |
| .jim/states/active-*.md | status=in_progress |

TEXT fields have no practical size limit (SQLite: 1GB).
Largest plan seen: 20KB. Safety margin: 59,880x.

## Proposed Workflow
1. /explore creates beads issue, stores findings in design field
2. User reviews via `bd edit <id> --design`
3. User continues via `/explore --continue` or `/explore <id>`
4. /prepare reads design field, creates child tasks, closes issue
5. No .jim/ needed

## Phases

**Phase 1: Explore Skill Migration**
1. Update explore to write findings to beads design field
2. Remove .jim/plans/ writes
3. Support --continue and issue ID args

**Phase 2: Prepare Skill Migration**
1. Read plan from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
2. Accept beads issue ID as input

**Phase 3: Review + Implement Updates**
1. Review stores findings in beads notes field
2. Implement reads context from beads design field

**Phase 4: CLAUDE.md + Cleanup**
1. Remove .jim/ documentation from global CLAUDE.md
2. Add beads field usage guidelines
3. Keep .jim/archive/ as read-only legacy (67 historical files)

## Risks
- bd edit less convenient than direct file editing
- JSONL diffs harder to review than markdown
- Archive migration (punt: keep read-only)

## Recommendation
Proceed with 4-phase migration. Start with explore+prepare
(highest value), then review+implement, then docs cleanup.
Keep .jim/archive/ read-only indefinitely.

title: Explore: remaining gaps in beads-native skill set
design:
4 gaps to fill: debug, gt, resume, fix.
Phase 1: /debug (CI failures, bugs, beads-integrated)
Phase 2: /gt (Graphite wrapper with beads sync)
Phase 3: /resume (reconnect after break, show in_progress beads)
Phase 4: /fix (quick fixes for review findings)

title: Build /review skill: code review, file bugs as beads
Eliminate .jim/ in favor of beads-native workflow
Phase 1: Explore skill migration
description:
1. Update explore skill to write findings to beads design field via bd update <id> --design
2. Remove .jim/plans/ write operations from explore skill
3. Support --continue flag and issue ID args for resuming explorations
4. Task agent writes to tmpfile, then stores via bd update <id> --design @<tmpfile>

title: Phase 2: Prepare skill migration
description:
1. Update prepare skill to read plan from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
2. Accept beads issue ID as input (bd show <id> --json to extract design)
3. Fall back to .jim/plans/ for backward compatibility during transition

title: Phase 3: Review + implement skill updates
description:
1. Update review skill to store findings in beads notes field instead of .jim/notes/
2. Update implement skill to read context from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
3. Remove all .jim/ write paths from both skills

title: Phase 4: CLAUDE.md + cleanup
description:
1. Remove .jim/ documentation section from global CLAUDE.md
2. Add beads field usage guidelines (design for plans, notes for reviews)
3. Keep .jim/archive/ as read-only legacy (67 historical files)
4. Validate full workflow: explore → prepare → implement → review → commit

title: Build /submit skill: Graphite submit + bd sync
